Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; faded added white bands at top and at bottom of sherd; exterior: painted decoration consisting of rump, tail and possibly edge of wing of possible sphinx to left; elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, the figure on the sherd is a feline. However, similar tails are also found on sphinxes.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 258, no. 476, pl. 65)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0506) (phase 2)
